readme:
üßæ Say goodbye to manual Venmo-to-QuickBooks formatting!  
This automated workflow transforms raw Venmo CSV exports into QuickBooks-ready files and backs them up seamlessly to Google Drive or Dropbox.

‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does:

üì§ 1. Accepts a Venmo CSV Upload  
‚Äî Triggers on form submission to upload a .csv Venmo transaction file.

üìÇ 2. Extracts Raw CSV Data  
‚Äî Reads the uploaded file and prepares it for processing.

üõ†Ô∏è 3. Generates a Smart File Name  
‚Äî Dynamically names the output file using the transaction month and timestamp:  
QB_Venmo_YYYY-MM_HHMM.csv.

üîÑ 4. Converts Raw Venmo Data  
‚Äî Filters invalid rows and transforms valid transactions into QuickBooks-friendly format:  
‚Ä¢ Standardizes field names (e.g., Amount (total) ‚Üí Amount)  
‚Ä¢ Builds descriptive transaction summaries based on context (e.g., transfers vs payments)

üìù 5. Creates a New CSV File  
‚Äî Structures the processed data into a new downloadable CSV.

‚òÅÔ∏è 6. Saves to Google Drive  
‚Äî Automatically uploads the finalized file to your selected folder in Google Drive.

üì¶ 7. (Optional) Backs Up to Dropbox  
‚Äî Also configured to upload to Dropbox (currently disabled).
